{{also|右将军}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=右将军|type=12}}

===Etymology===
General of the Right (along with General of the Left, Front and Rear) was usually picked based on abilities rather than family ties, and was directly subordinate to the central government.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=yòu jiāngjūn
|cat=n
}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|archaic}} ''General of the Right'' (a high [[military]] [[rank]] held by [[general]]s in ancient [[China]])
